A G V

A

audio.descriptors - package audio.descriptors
 
AudioDescriptor - Class in audio.descriptors
AudioDescriptor is the class that contains all the functions that provide low-level audio signal features.
AudioDescriptor(PApplet) - Constructor for class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Default constructor
AudioDescriptor() - Constructor for class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
No-parameter constructor

G

getBrightness(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The spectral brightness is defined as the amount of energy in the spectrum starting from a specified cutoff frequency (in this case 1500 Hz), divided by the total energy of the signal spectrum
getCentroid(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The spectral centroid is the baricenter of the spectrum; it is calculated as the weighted mean of the frequencies present in the signal, with their magnitude as the weights.
getEntropy(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The Spectral Entropy is computed as the Shannon’s entropy of the signal spectrum.
getFlatness(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Spectral flatness provides a way to quantify how tone-like a sound is, as opposed to being noise-like.
getFlux(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Spectral flux is a measure of how quickly the power spectrum of a signal is changing, calculated by comparing the power spectrum of half a frame against the power spectrum of the other half.
getFundFreq(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
This function computes the fundamental frequency of the examined signal.
getHR(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The harmonic ratio (HR) is a measure of the proportion of harmonic components in the power spectrum.
getInharmonicity(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Inharmonicity estimates the amount of partials that are not multiples of the fundamental frequency.
getIrregularity(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The irregularity of a spectrum is the degree of variation of the successive peaks of the spectrum.
getKurtosis(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The kurtosis gives a measure of the flatness of the spectrum around its mean value.

getLeftMFCC(AudioSource, int) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Mel-Frequency Cepstral Coefficients (MFCC) originate from automatic speech recognition.
getLeftRoughness(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The roughness of a signal is related to the beating phenomena between the peaks of its spectrum.
getLeftSkewness(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The skewness gives a measure of the asymmetry of the spectrum around its mean value.
getLeftSpread(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The spectrum spread is also called instantaneous bandwidth; it is defined as the second central moment (i.e.
getLeftSTE(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
Short Time Energy (STE) expresses the instant energy of each frame, and is commonly known as volume.
getLeftZCR(AudioSource) - Method in class audio.descriptors.AudioDescriptor
The zero-crossing rate is the rate of sign-changes along a signal, i.e., the rate at which the signal changes from positive to negative or back.
